alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Shackelford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 4:56PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Callahan and southwestern Shackelford Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 456 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Us-283 Near The Callahan- Shackelford County Line, or 9 miles northeast of Hamby, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clyde, Baird, Rowden, Eula, Dudley, Oplin, Mccarty Lake, Admiral, Us- 283 Near The Callahan-Shackelford County Line and Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 294 and 315. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
